name: shell_exec
description: Execute a shell command on the host system. **WARNING**: This provides direct system access and should be used carefully. Avoid commands that could harm the system or expose sensitive data.

command_line.description: The shell command to execute. Examples: 'ls -la', 'python script.py', 'curl https://api.example.com'. Avoid commands with user input that could cause injection attacks. Always validate and sanitize inputs.

working_directory.description: Directory to run the command in. Use absolute paths (e.g., '/home/user/project', '/tmp'). If not specified, uses current working directory.

timeout.description: Maximum execution time in seconds (1-3600). Commands exceeding this will be terminated. Default: 60 seconds. Use 0 for no timeout (dangerous for long-running commands).

environment.description: Environment variables to set for this command execution. Format: {"VAR_NAME": "value"}. Examples: {"DEBUG": "true", "API_KEY": "secret123"}

shell.description: Shell interpreter to use. Common options: '/bin/bash' (default on most systems), '/bin/sh' (POSIX shell), '/bin/zsh'. Leave empty to use system default.
